intro: Humboltia phalangifera, commonly known as the desert hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico. It is characterized by its thick, fleshy stems and broad, waxy leaves that help reduce water loss in its harsh environment. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers in shades of yellow to orange, which bloom during the warm seasons. It is adapted to thrive in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a resilient species in desert ecosystems. Humboltia phalangifera is often used in xeriscaping due to its low water requirements and ornamental value.
